result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt Russell Lasee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Revocation to begin upon notice from DOT.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the officer due within 30 days and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall obtain/maintain full time employment.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant may petition the court for expungement upon successful completion of probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin at the discretion of probation and may be served on the weekends.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

Final Notice
In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Kurt Russell Lasee in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Plea of guilty to the charge.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses citations 14TR1017 and 14TR1016.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1 - fleeing an officer.  Argument by counsel.   Court orders withheld sentence probation 18 months with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; letter of apology to the officer due within 30 days; obtain/maintain full time employment; counseling as deemed appropriate; six month revocation of driver's license; 5 days county jail with huber to begin at agent's discretion and may be served on weekends at the agent's discretion.      Defendant may petition the court for expungement.  - rt

Adjourned initial appearance on February 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Kurt Russell Lasee in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.  Defendant would like an attorney.  Defendant waives the time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
arrest

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $3,000,00 signature bond; booking; no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Court orders $3,000.00 signature bond; booking and no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Notice of right to an attorney given to defendant.  Next court date is scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. - rt
